author: bharath.vedartham
content:
hey <@&836981489430036500> folks, i m seeing the below errors in mev-boost for teku:
```
time="2025-07-31T10:04:24.299Z" level=error msg="failed to decode signed blinded beacon block" error="missing eth-consensus-version" method=handleGetPayloadV2 parsedProposerContentType=application/octet-stream proposerContentType=application/octet-stream proposerEthConsensusVersion= userAgent="mev-boost/ okhttp/4.12.0" version=
```
looks like teku is not sending the `Eth-Consensus-Version` flag? a lot of teku blocks are being missed because of this i believe

author: mininny
content:
Hey guys, while testing various spamming scenarios in our devnet, we noticed some different behavior regarding data column reconstruction in supernodes when the getBlobs hit rate is decreased. We are seeing much more active data column reconstruction in prysm compared to lighthouse/teku/grandine, and was wondering if there was some difference in spec implementation. 

While this is in draft, you can find relevant information about this in the `Bandwidth limited` section of this draft report: https://testinprod.notion.site/Draft-Sunnyside-Devnet-Updates-ETA-8-4-23a8fc57f546807b976fcc73e68ce933#2408fc57f546804bb96fd3d9c1c2c1c6

author: fradamt
content: Imo it doesn't make much sense to constrain supernode bandwidth to 100/50 mbps, we know that's not enough for the blob counts that are being tested

author: fradamt
content: if you haven't run scenario 3 of the devnet 2 in the doc (perfect PeerDAS), I would consider changing those limits for supernodes

author: mininny
content: CL data column reconstruction

author: manunlp
content: (posting a screenshot because for some reasons Discord is not happy with this message)

author: agnxsh
content: It’s very rare but there are multiple workers who sample randomly from different peers

author: agnxsh
content: It might be so that all of the workers acquired this particular prysm peer at the same time

author: manunlp
content: I see it quite often

author: agnxsh
content: Is it a problem tho?

author: agnxsh
content: For faster syncing I do need multiple workers who sample

author: agnxsh
content: We generally request a larger superset of columns and receive whatever they have this just prevents us from handpicking and rearranging the requests per peer and just saves some time overall

author: agnxsh
content: But if people aren’t ok with it, I’ll construct specific requests, we usually request whatever we have missing even if there is 1 intersection column, and multiple workers do it, so there can be repititions

author: sauliusgrigaitis
content: Can you share Kurtosis config?

author: pawandhananjay
content: are the columns repeated in the same byroot request? seems wasteful to me

author: agnxsh
content: It maybe repeated, it’s sent by different workers, to retrieve faster

author: manunlp
content: Yes in the exact came byRoot request. Agree seems wasteful

author: manunlp
content: Different workers "merge" their byRoot requests before sending them? If so, why not just removing duplicates?

author: agnxsh
content: I’ll check
